isis.stitle: AFC 03904 - Removal of Part Number 3566852C1 Certification Label on certain 9400i models built at Escobedo from 8/26/99 through 5/28/01

afc.subject: Removal of Part Number 3566852C1 Certification Label on certain 9400i models built at Escobedo from 8/26/99 through 5/28/01

para.exhotlnk: Print ready (PDF file) copy of the AFC letter

geninfo.para: This campaign covers 9400i models built without anti-lock brakes (ABS) from 8/26/99 through 5/28/01 at the Escobedo Plant.

The vehicles identified above may have certification label 3566852C1 (see Figure 1) mistakenly installed on the inside door opening on the driver side. This label certifies that the vehicle conforms to all applicable U.S. Motor Vehicle Safety Standards. Because these vehicles do not have anti-lock brakes (ABS), the vehicle DOES NOT CONFORM to all U.S. Motor Vehicle Safety Standards.

All 9200 and 9400i models without anti-lock brakes (ABS) should be inspected for 3566852C1 certification label when the vehicle is brought in for service. If label part number 3566852C1 is found installed on a vehicle without anti-lock brakes (ABS), the label must be removed.

laborinfo.para: Operation number must appear on all claims.

claims.para: Mexican locations are to submit warranty claims in the usual manner making reference to Authorized Field Change Number G-03904.

It is important that the coding be completed properly to assist in processing the warranty claim. Complete instructions will be found in the Warranty Manual, Section 7-1. Special attention should be given to Items 39 through 44.

To assure this important improvement is made in a timely manner, all claims for G-03904 activity must be submitted by April 30, 2004 or within the normal warranty period for the vehicle, if after April 30, 2004.
